intro: Pterospermadendron pierrei, commonly known as the Sierra Madre ash, is a member of the family Bombacaceae and is native to Mexico. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, gray bark and compound leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry forest and scrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
